abstract: Ashton B Carter, at Senate confirmation hearing on his nomination as secretary of defense, says he will weigh more American military aid to Ukraine, including sale of lethal weapons, as part of its battle with Russian-backed separatists.
lead_paragraph: At a confirmation hearing, Ashton B. Carter said he would consider selling lethal arms to Ukraine as part of its effort to fight Russian-backed separatists in the east.

headline.main: Defense Nominee Says He Would Consider More U.S. Military Aid to Ukraine
headline.print_headline: Defense Nominee Says He Would Consider More U.S. Military Aid to Ukraine

snippet: At a confirmation hearing, Ashton B. Carter said he would consider selling lethal arms to Ukraine as part of its effort to fight Russian-backed separatists in the east.
